DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Alexandre Souto Martinez fez o Bacharelado (86) e Mestrado (88) em Física no Instituto de Física de São Carlos (IFSC) da Universidade de São Paulo (USP), Brasil. Obteve o ``Diplôme des Etudes Approfondies'' (DEA) (90) e o Doutorado (93) pela Universidade Joseph Fourier (Grenoble I), França. Fez Pós-Doutorado (94-96) na Universidade de Genebra, Suíça e (96-98) no Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE) em São José dos Campos, Brasil. Desde 98 é docente da Faculdade de Filosofia, Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto (FFCLRP) da Universidade de São Paulo (USP). Em 2005, tornou-se Livre Docente e em 2013 Professor Associado 3. Supervisiou 4 pesquisadores de pós-doutorado, orientou 11 alunos de doutorado e 9 de mestrado. Atualmente supervisiona 1 pesquisadores de pós-doutorado, orienta 2 alunos de doutorado, 7 de Mestrado e 0 de Iniciação Científica. Foi Coordenador do Programa de Pós-Graduação de Física Aplicada à Medicina e Biologia (FAMB) (06-08), Chefe do Departamento de Física e Matemática (08-10) e Presidente de Comissão de Relações Internacionais da FFCLRP (12-13). Desde 2013, é Diretor do Centro de Tecnologia da Informação no campus da USP de Ribeirão Preto. Conta com mais de 85 artigos publicados, quase 1300 citações e h = 16.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor (1986) and Master (1988) in Physics at University de São Paulo. D.E.A. (1990) and PhD (1993) in Physics at University Joseph Fourier (Grenoble I) (1990). Experience in Physic, focusing on Physical Statistics and Thermodynamics, acting on the following subjects: disordered (random) media, deterministic and stochastic walks and weak localization and scattering of light.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Foi coordenador do Programa de Pós-Graduação de Física Aplicada à Medicina e Biologia (FAMB) da Faculdade de Filosofia,Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto (FFCLRP) da Universidade de São Paulo (USP) de 08/2006 e 07/2008.
Foi chefe do Departamento de Física e Matemática da Faculdade de Filosofia,Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto (FFCLRP) da Universidade de São Paulo (USP), de 08/2008 a 07/2010. O Departamento contava com aproximadamente 50 doocentes, 20 funcionários e gerenciava 4 cursos de graduação (Física Médica, Ciência da Informação, Informática Biomédica e Matemática Aplicada a Negócios) e um de pós-graduação (Física Aplicada à Medicina e Biologia). Como chefe, participei do processo de divisão do Departamento, que se realizou em 12/2010.
Foi avaliador externo do CNPq do XIX, XX, XXI e XXII Congresso de Iniciação Científica da UNESP na área de Ciências Exatas (Presidente Prudente, José dos Campos, São José do Rio Preto e Marília).
Membro do Instituto Nacional de Ciência e Tecnologia em Sistemas Complexos (12/2008).
O orientado Brenno Caetano Trocca Cabella fez estágio de janeiro a junho de 2009 na Universidade McMaster, Hamilton, no Canada com bolsa da embaixada canadense. A orientada de mestrado Juliana Militão da Silva Berbert fez estágio de janeiro a junho de 2009 na Universidade McGill, Montreal, no Canada com bolsa da embaixada canadense. O orientado de doutorado Lindomar Soares dos Santos fez estágio de agosto 2009 a fevereiro de 2010 na Universidade de Guelph, Guelph, no Canada com bolsa da embaixada canadense. O orientado de doutorado Marcelo Alves Pereira fez estágio de outubro 2009 a abril de 2010 na Universidade McMaster, Hamilton, no Canada com bolsa da embaixada canadense.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Um dos principais objetivos deste projeto de recomposição florestal é o de formação de um Banco Genético de espécies arbóreas nativas de florestas da Bacia Hidrográfica do Pardo-Mogi. Para obter a matriz de plantio, utilizamos o programa de otimização, desenvolvido quando estive na Universidade de Sussex, para levar em consideração muitas variáveis como a origem das sementes para a produção de mudas, a categoria ecológica de cada uma das 50 espécies utilizadas e a proporção entre elas, a manutenção de distância razoável entre plantas-irmãs, entre outras, para garantir hetereogeneidade espacial que promova futuramente cruzamento que resultem em uma maior diversidade genética dos descendentes.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (CNPq PQ II 305527/2004-5) Propagação e localização de ondas e partículas em meios desordenados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A propagação de ondas em meios turvos tem sua origem na teoria cinética. A modelagem deste sistema se dá pela interação de ondas quânticas ou clássicas com um meio que não apresenta invariância por translação. A natureza desordenada do meio faz com que as interferências não-triviais entre as ondas possam ser desprezadas em processos de média configuracional e a propagação de ondas é descrita por teorias clássicas de transporte. Se os espalhamentos das ondas pelas imperfeições do meio forem elásticas, se estas imperfeições forem locais e densas, as interferências de ondas devem imperativamente ser consideradas o que produz a redução da difusividade (localização). Um exemplo de mudanças de regimes de propagação e localização (transição de Anderson) é a transição de Mott (metal/isolante). No espaço transformado de Fourier, este problema é descrito em termos de partículas. Neste caso a localização é expressa pelos caminhos fechados formado pelas colisões das partículas com as imperfeições do meio. Neste trabalho, dois aspectos distintos e independentes da dinâmica de partículas em meios desordenados são abordados. Esta dinâmica pode ser determinista com memória, que tende aprisionar as partículas, ou estocástica, que tende a deslocalizar as partículas. Têm-se vários objetivos: a) melhor compreender as distribuições de probabilidades relevantes deste problema, b) entender a transição entre estes dois regimes (transição localização/propagação), c) comprovar a nossa conjectura de que é na transição entre os regimes mencionados que se tem o melhor compromisso entre as vantagens da exploração e os gastos com as trajetórias e d) tentar estabelecer analogias mais formais com o problema de localização de Anderson. Consideraremos também neste trabalho o espalhamento múltiplo de ondas vetoriais por esferas magnéticas e o campo interno. O aspecto vetorial do campo eletromagnético foi desprezado nos primeiros estudos deste sistema.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (FAPESP 2005/02408-0) Propagação e localização de ondas e partículas em meios desordenados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Modelos para a propagação de ondas em meios turvos têm origem na teoria cinética dos gases. A modelagem deste sistema se dá pela interação de ondas quânticas ou clássicas com um meio que não apresenta invariância por translação. A natureza desordenada do meio faz com que as interferências não-triviais entre as ondas possam ser desprezadas nos processos de média configuracional e a propagação de ondas é descrita pelas teorias clássicas de transporte. Se os espalhamentos das ondas pelas imperfeições do meio forem elásticas, se estas imperfeições forem locais e densas, as interferências de ondas devem imperativamente ser consideradas o que produz a redução da difusividade, transição entre propagação e localização de Anderson que tem como exemplo a transição metal-isolante de Mott. No espaço transformado de Fourier, este problema é descrito em termos de partículas. Neste caso a localização é expressa pelos caminhos fechados formado pelas colisões das partículas com as imperfeições do meio. Aqui são abordados os aspectos: determinista (que tende aprisionar partículas) e estocástico (que tende deslocalizar as partículas) em meios desordenados. Têm-se vários objetivos: a) melhor compreender as distribuições de probabilidades relevantes deste problema, b) entender a transição entre estes dois regimes (transição localização/propagação), c) comprovar a nossa conjectura de que é na transição entre os regimes mencionados que se tem o melhor compromisso entre as vantagens da exploração e os gastos com as trajetórias e d) tentar estabelecer analogias mais formais com o problema de localização de Anderson. Consideraremos também neste trabalho o espalhamento múltiplo de ondas vetoriais por esferas magnéticas e o campo interno. O aspecto vetorial do campo eletromagnético foi desprezado nos primeiros estudos deste sistema. Nos últimos anos introduzimos os modelos mencionados buscando uma melhor compreensão do efeito da desordem com relação aos aspectos locais e globais de grandezas

ORIENTACAO.TITULO-ORIENTACAO: Propagação de Ondas em Meios Desordenados
Monitoria PAE na disciplina de Introdução à Probabilidade e Estatística II

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (CNPq Projeto Universal 476722/2010-1): Propagação e Localização de Ondas e Partículas em Meios Desordenados e Sistemas Complexos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O maior objetivo desde projeto de pesquisa é a compreensão dos diversos aspectos de transições de uma fase dita localizada (não-ergódica) da outra dita estendida (ergódica) na difusão de ondas ou partículas em meios desordenados. Estes sistemas podem estar em- ou fora-do-equilíbrio e em sistemas complexos. A desordem de um meio material é representada pelas flutuações de algumas de suas grandezas características. Ela tem o papel de quebrar a simetria de translação de um substrato homogêneo. Isto pode levar um dado sistema a apresentar comportamentos distintos quando perturbado por ondas ou partículas (propagação/localização). No último século, tais sistemas foram quase que exclusivamente tratados no contexto da teoria de transporte. Esta teoria despreza a coerência de fase entre ondas ou correlações na movimentação de partículas. Nas últimas décadas, porém, observações experimentais (localização fraca de ondas) evidenciaram que novos sistemas físicos (mesoscópicos, por exemplo) apresentam comportamentos que não podem ser explicados por tal formalismo. Estes sistemas, que podem ser clássicos, apresentam trajetórias fechadas para partículas ou, para ondas, interferências que não são destruídas pelo processo de média sobre a desordem. Com a finalidade de abordar em detalhes as diferentes facetas deste problema dividimos este projeto de pesquisa em quatro partes. Na primeira parte consideramos a propagação de partículas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através de caminhadas com memória, que podem ser deterministas ou estocásticas. Na segunda parte consideramos a propagação de ondas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através do espalhamento de ondas eletromagnéticas por impurezas, que consideraremos como sendo magnéticas. A terceira parte consiste no estudo de alguns sistemas complexos. Neste caso, estamos interessados em compreender diversos aspectos relativos às possíveis transições de fase que possam ocorrer, como por exemplo no dilema do pris
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: O maior objetivo desde projeto de pesquisa é a compreensão dos diversos aspectos de transições de uma fase dita localizada (não-ergódica) da outra dita estendida (ergódica) na difusão de ondas ou partículas em meios desordenados. Na primeira parte consideramos a propagação de partículas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através de caminhadas com memória, que podem ser deterministas ou estocásticas. Na segunda parte consideramos a propagação de ondas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através do espalhamento de ondas eletromagnéticas por impurezas, que consideraremos como sendo magnéticas. A terceira parte consiste no estudo de alguns sistemas complexos. Neste caso, estamos interessados em compreender diversos aspectos relativos às possíveis transições de fase que possam ocorrer, como por exemplo no dilema do pris

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (CNPq PQ II - 303990/2007-4) Propagação e Localização de ondas e partículas em meios desordenados.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A propagação de ondas em meios turvos tem sua origem na teoria cinética. A modelagem deste sistema se dá pela interação de ondas quânticas ou clássicas com um meio que não apresenta invariância por translação. A natureza desordenada do meio faz com que as interferências não-triviais entre as ondas possam ser desprezadas em processos de média configuracional e a propagação de ondas é descrita por teorias clássicas de transporte. Se os espalhamentos das ondas pelas imperfeições do meio forem elásticas, se estas imperfeições forem locais e densas, as interferências de ondas devem imperativamente ser consideradas o que produz a redução da difusividade (localização). Um exemplo de mudanças de regimes de propagação e localização (transição de Anderson) é a transição de Mott (metal/isolante). No espaço transformado de Fourier, este problema é descrito em termos de partículas. Neste caso a localização é expressa pelos caminhos fechados formado pelas colisões das partículas com as imperfeições do meio. Neste trabalho, dois aspectos distintos e independentes da dinâmica de partículas em meios desordenados são abordados. Esta dinâmica pode ser determinista com memória, que tende aprisionar as partículas, ou estocástica, que tende a deslocalizar as partículas. Têm-se vários objetivos: a) melhor compreender as distribuições de probabilidades relevantes deste problema, b) entender a transição entre estes dois regimes (transição localização/propagação), c) comprovar a nossa conjectura de que é na transição entre os regimes mencionados que se tem o melhor compromisso entre as vantagens da exploração e os gastos com as trajetórias e d) tentar estabelecer analogias mais formais com o problema de localização de Anderson. Consideraremos também neste trabalho o espalhamento múltiplo de ondas vetoriais por esferas magnéticas e o campo interno. O aspecto vetorial do campo eletromagnético foi desprezado nos primeiros estudos deste sistema.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Faculdade de Filosofia Ciências e Letras de Ribeirão Preto

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ( CNPq Projeto Universal 485155/2013 ) Sistemas Complexos e Espalhamento de Ondas Eletromagnéticas por Metamateriais
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O maior objetivo desde projeto de pesquisa é a compreensão dos diversos aspectos de transições de uma fase dita localizada (não-ergódica) da outra dita estendida (ergódica) na difusão de ondas ou partículas em meios desordenados.
Com a finalidade de abordar em detalhes as diferentes facetas deste problema dividimos este projeto de pesquisa em quatro partes. Na primeira parte consideramos a propagação de partículas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através de caminhadas com memória, que podem ser deterministas ou estocásticas. Na segunda parte consideramos a propagação de ondas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através do espalhamento de ondas eletromagnéticas por impurezas, que consideraremos como sendo magnéticas. A terceira parte consiste no estudo de alguns sistemas complexos. Neste caso, estamos interessados em compreender diversos aspectos relativos às possíveis transições de fase que possam ocorrer em modelos epidemiológicos realistas de denge e tuberculose e modelos de econofísica.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: ( CNPq Projeto Universal 485155/2013 ) Sistemas Complexos e Espalhamento de Ondas Eletromagnéticas por Metamateriais

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (CNPq Bolsa Pesquisador Visitante Especial (PVE) do CNPq 400162/2014-8) Evaluating Strategies for Prevention and Control of Dengue Using Quantitative Decision-Support Methods
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: This proposal will develop quantitative methods for evaluating the risk and outcomes of dengue outbreaks, by employing the latest methodologies and sources of data; computational models to evaluate the effect of a new vaccine candidate on reducing the risk of infection and severe haemorrhagic dengue fever; and ultimately, integrate the models into a prototype decision support tool to inform intervention strategies for reducing the burden of dengue infection both socially and economically. Dengue remains a major public health concern in tropics across the world, especially in the Americas, where it is now endemic. Worldwide, there are an estimated 2.5-3.6 billion individuals at risk, with annual estimates of 50-230 million new cases, about 500,000 hospitalizations, and 25,000 fatal cases. This vector-borne disease inflicts substantial economic and healthcare costs in Brazil and some neighbouring countries. Brazil has a higher incidence and, greater economic burden of dengue than any other country in the Americas, representing over 40% of the total costs of dengue burden in the region. For example, in the 2008 dengue outbreak in Rio de Janeiro, over 155,000 cases of dengue fever and more than 1000 cases of dengue haemorrhagic fever were reported in the first four months of the year alone. This outbreak claimed 110 lives, of whom 50% were children. These considerations highlight the significant public health problem Brazil faces in addressing dengue and clearly justify continuing efforts to control the disease. Recent advances in information and computing technologies (e.g., communication, data storage, distributed sensing, artificial intelligence, and high performance computing), dengue surveillance including novel diagnostic tests and mosquito trapping techniques, and climate monitoring and projection, have made possible to collect and integrate various existing and emerging data sources into coherent decision-support tools for public policy. A critically important application of an integrated system of modelling, data analysis, and simulations is to generate realistic multivariable outbreak signals, to evaluate the effectiveness and costs-effectiveness of health responses at the early stages of an outbreak, and to assist in quantifying the risk of disease and severe outcomes. Although significant research efforts are being considered in this direction, the proposed research will undertake to, for the first time, bring this capability to Brazil in the context of dengue decision-support using quantitative computational systems. In February 2013, Going Global Innovation of the government of Canada supported a Canada- Brazil workshop on ?Heath Informatics and Infectious Disease Dynamics?, hosted by the University of São Paulo, Faculty of Medicine. During the workshop, the applicants in this proposal solidified their collaborative work towards achieving common goals through integration of expertise and resources in a multidisciplinary fashion. This research builds upon strengths and quality of the involved institutes with internationally recognized capacity and partnerships to achieve the objectives in informing preventive and control strategies against dengue.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: (CNPq Bolsa Pesquisador Visitante Especial (PVE) do CNPq 400162/2014-8) Evaluating Strategies for Prevention and Control of Dengue Using Quantitative Decision-Support Methods

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: (CNPq Projeto Universal ): Propagação de ondas e partículas em meios desordenados e em sistemas complexos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A desordem de um meio material é representada pelas flutuações de algumas de suas grandezas características. Ela tem o papel de quebrar a simetria de translação de um substrato homogêneo. Isto pode levar um dado sistema a apresentar comportamentos distintos quando perturbado por ondas ou partículas (propagação/localização). No último século, tais sistemas foram quase que exclusivamente tratados no contexto da teoria de transporte. Esta teoria despreza a coerência de fase entre ondas ou correlações na movimentação de partículas. Nas últimas décadas, porém, observações experimentais (localização fraca de ondas) evidenciaram que novos sistemas físicos (mesoscópicos, por exemplo) apresentam comportamentos que não podem ser explicados por tal formalismo. Estes sistemas, que podem ser clássicos, apresentam ou trajetórias fechadas para partículas ou interferência para ondas. Com a finalidade de abordar em detalhes as diferentes facetas deste problema dividimos este projeto de pesquisa em três partes. Na primeira parte consideramos a propagação de partículas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através de caminhadas com memória, que podem ser deterministas ou estocásticas. Na segunda parte consideramos a propagação de ondas em meios desordenados. A propagação se dá através do espalhamento de ondas eletromagnéticas por impurezas que consideraremos como sendo magnéticas. A terceira parte consiste no estudo de alguns sistemas complexos. Neste caso, estamos interessados em compreender diversos aspectos relativos às possíveis transições de fase que possam ocorrer, como por exemplo no dilema do prisioneiro iterado, ou na elaboração de modelos probabilísticos que de algum modo possam gerar distribuições de probabilidade com uma componente do tipo lei de potência.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Turbidity and turbulence effects on the propagation of the optical radiation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The research concerns studies on the propagation of the optical radiation in turbid and turbulent media, applied to image transport, degradation and correction, testing of materials and remote sensing by lidar. Calculations regarding propagation in turbid media are related to image degradation and multiple scattering in remote sensing techniques.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Multiple scattering effects on lidar return from space
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The objective of the present contract is to quantify the multiple scattering contribution to the lidar return from space in multilayeredred cloud structures as well as for crystal (non-spherical scatterers) cloud. This study involves the comparison of several calculation methods (different Monte Carlo codes and the analytical extension of the Mie theory).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Assessment of multiple scattering effects for spaceborne backscattering LIDAR signal processing
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A potential of the lidar remote sensing from satellites is the provision of global cover data on scattering and extinction properties of the various atmospheric layers, e.g. on the extent, height distribution and optical thickness of aerosols and clouds. The long distance separates the lidar polar pratform and the scattering targets. The multiple scattering effects for a spaceborn lidar is a consequence of the measurement geometry. A large footprint of the lidar receiver field of view (FOV) covers a great conical domain caught within the scattering atmosphere.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Técnicas de inversão aplicadas ao espalhamento simples e múltiplo da luz por partículas esféricas e não-esféricas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Um problema inverso envolve a determinação de causas desconhecidas a partir da observação de seus efeitos. Este tipo de problema aparece com freqüência em diversas áreas da ciência e da engenharia e exige em geral técnicas matemáticas e computacionais sofisticadas para a suas resolução. O objetivo deste projeto é o desenvolvimento de técnicas de inversão aplicadas ao espalhamento de luz por partículas esféricas e não-esféricas. Este problema é de grande relevância do ponto de vista de aplicações. Por exemplo, a caracterização dos centros espalhadores é importante na classificação de nuvens e aerosois através de sensoriamento remoto da atmosfera por satélites. Na industria, há interesse no controle de produção de fuligem produzida por fornos na queima do petróleo. Geralmente o estudo do espalhamento da luz é realizado considerando uma única etapa de espalhamento e a esfericidade dos centros espalhadores. No entanto, em muitas situações de interesse prático estas aproximações são inaceitáveis. Em meteorologia, por exemplo, a espessura ótica das nuvens do tipo cúmulus ou cirrus e de certas camadas de aerosois inviabiliza a utilização do modelo de um único espalhamento. Por outro lado, os cristais de água formados nas nuvens cirrus e os aglomerados de partículas na fuligem invibializam a aproximação de espalhamento esférico. Neste estudo pretende-se aplicar as novas técnicas de inversão em desevolvimento no Laboratório Associados de Computação e Matemática Aplicada em conjunto com o programa de Monte Carlo desenvolvido pelo bolsista que simula a propagação de luz em meios desordenados para a caracterização geométrica dos centros espalhadores. Complementarmente implememtaremos um modelo numérico para o cálculo do espalhamento por partículas não esféricas.
Processo: 381181/97-9 CNPq/RAHE/DTI

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Novas metodologias para a reconstrução de perfis de temperatura e umidade na atmosfera a partir de dados de sensoriamento remoto
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Problemas inversos envolvem a determinação de causas desconhecidas a partir da observação de seus efeitos. Este tipo de problema aparece com freqüência em ciência e tecnologia e exige técnicas matemáticas e computacionais sofisticadas para sua resolução. O projeto tem por objetivo o desenvolvimento de umn algoritmo para a reconstrução de perfis de temperatura e umidade na atmosfera a partir de medidas de radiância obtidas remotamente por satélite. Esta técnica de inversão é de grande importância no campo da meteorologia, tendo sido objeto de inúmeros trabalhos teóricos e experimentais. Apesar da vasta literatura sobre o assunto, as metodologias atuais de inversão exibem ainda limitações que podem implicar em erros algumas vezes inaceitáveis para certas aplicações. Este problema é de natureza mal posta, levando em geral a soluções múltiplas e instáveis com relação ao ruído presente nos dados experimentais.
Processo: 360499/96-1 Modalidade: CNPq/RAHE/DTI-7C

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
There are four major objetives for the visit: a) Presentation and discussion of the developments that has been made so far in the application of an evolutionary approach to ant inverse problem in meteorology, b) discussion, evaluation and possible reorientation of the research activities in heat transfer that are being carried out, c) discussion about the experiments recently performed in Sussex in inverse design with evolutionary computation techniques and d) evaluation of the "Distribuited Genetic Algorithm" toolkit developed at Sussex, as an alternative programming environment for the project.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
fator de impacto: 1.190 citações até 01/03/2000: 1
We discuss the relation between two standard approaches applied to diffusion in the presence of anisotropic scattering. The diffusion constant obtained from the Boltzmann equation is different from that obtained by a random walk model with fixed step length. By varying the step length according to a Lambert-Beer law we recover the Boltzmann result.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
fator de impacto: 1.190 citações até 01/03/2000: 1

The diffusion constant obtained from the Boltzmann equation is different from that obtained by a random walk model with fixed step length. By varying the step length according to a Lambert-Beer law we recover the Boltzmann result.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Phase diagram of the one-state potts model on the Cayley tree
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Phase diagram of the one-state potts model on the Cayley tree

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
fator de impacto: 1.404 citações até 01/03/2000: 4
The phase diagram of the one-state Potts model on the closed asymmetric Cayley tree with braching ratio $r = 2$ is obtained from the Bethe-Peierls map. The route to chaos, via period doubling cascade, is obtained by considering the antiferromagnetic coupling limit. The connection of the Potts model with the percolation problem is shown by calculation the order parameter, its susceptibility, the internal energy, and the specific heat as well as their asymptotic behavior at the paramagnetic-ferromagnetic critical point. Due to the type of the lattice and to the polynomial character of the map, this is the simplest known example of a McKay-Berker-Kirkpatrick spin-glass.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
fator de impacto: 1.404 citações até 01/03/2000: 4

Due to the type of the lattice and to the polynomial character of the map, this is the simplest known example of a McKay-Berker-Kirkpatrick spin-glass.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Pair-correlation function of the Potts model on the Cayley tree
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Pair-correlation function of the Potts model on the Cayley tree

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
citações até 01/03/2000: 2
A recursive relation to calculate the pair-correlation function of the $q$-state (ferromagnetic) Potts model on a Cayley tree with a homogeneous magnetic field applied to its surface spins is presented. The results are reduced to the calculation of the pair-correlation function of the model defined on a finite chain.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Single and multiple scattering of light by magnetic particles and their implications to the coherent backscattering effect are reported. Single;scattering of light by small magnetic particles presents unusual features such as forward-backward asymmetry and resonance effects. In multiple scattering, this leads to a global decrease in the localization parameter k l*, which exhibits an oscillatory dependence on the scatterer magnetic permeability. By considering magnetic scatterers following a Curie-Weiss susceptibility law, we suggest that kl* can be tuned by varying the temperature.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Single and multiple scattering of light by magnetic particles and their implications to the coherent backscattering effect are reported. Single;scattering of light by small magnetic particles presents unusual features such as forward-backward asymmetry and resonance effects. In multiple scattering, this leads to a global decrease in the localization parameter k l*, which exhibits an oscillatory dependence on the scatterer magnetic permeability. By considering magnetic scatterers following a Curie-Weiss susceptibility law, we suggest that kl* can be tuned by varying the temperature.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The production of males in queenright colonies of Tetragonisca angustula angustula (Hymenoptera, Meliponinae)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Unlike honey bees, some stingless bees can produce both trophic and reproductive eggs. While trophic egg production by workers is widespread in a great number of meliponid species, serving as food for the queen, little is known about worker production of reproductive eggs which give rise to males. In Tetragonisca angustula angustula all males reared in a colony, are exclusively produced by the queen while the workers produce trophic eggs. Through 13 consecutive months of observations of two colonies, males were produced mainly from February to May, although small numbers were produced in other months. The number of males in colony(a) was correlated with the number of honey pots($r(s)=0.72$ $P<0.001$), the number of pollen pots ($r(s)=0.64$ $P<0.01$) and the number of brood combs present in the colony ($r(s)=0.57$ $P<0.01$). Concerning colony (b), the number of males was also correlated with the number of honey pots ($r(s)=0.71$ $P<0.01$), and the number of pollen pots($r(s)=0.55$ $P<0.05$). It is hypothesized that as the food supply of a colony increases, so does the food consumption by workers, which promotes the development of their ovaries. As a consequence, more trophic eggs are produced which are consumed subsequently by the queen. Thus, the queen's egg-laying capacity increases as well as the colony as a whole.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Electromagnetic scattering by small magnetic particles
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Electromagnetic scattering by small magnetic particles

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: esp. ondas eletromagnética por part. magnéticas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The scattering of electromagnetic (EM) waves by small magnetic particles is studied. We show that EM scattering by small magnetic particles exhibits some unusual features, such as the preferential backward scattering and resonance effects for some values of the relative magnetic permeability mu, even in the small-particle limit. The fact that mu is strongly dependent on the applied magnetic field and on the temperature makes EM scattering by magnetic particles a tunable mechanism. Some possible applications of this fact are discussed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The scattering of electromagnetic (EM) waves by small magnetic particles is studied. We show that EM scattering by small magnetic particles exhibits some unusual features, such as the preferential backward scattering and resonance effects for some values of the relative magnetic permeability mu, even in the small-particle limit. The fact that mu is strongly dependent on the applied magnetic field and on the temperature makes EM scattering by magnetic particles a tunable mechanism. Some possible applications of this fact are discussed.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The energy transport velocity nu (E) and the diffusion constant D of electromagnetic waves in the presence of randomly distributed ferromagnetic scatterers are studied. nu (E) presents a strong dependence on the relative magnetic permeability mu. and, unlike the nonmagnetic case, exhibits sharp drops in the small-particle limit and never coincides with the phase velocity nu (p). Both nu (E) and D exhibit an oscillatory dependence on mu and vanish for certain values of mu. Since mu. of ferromagnetic scatterers strongly depends on the temperature and applied magnetic field, we suggest that these facts can be explored in technological applications.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The energy transport velocity nu (E) and the diffusion constant D of electromagnetic waves in the presence of randomly distributed ferromagnetic scatterers are studied. nu (E) presents a strong dependence on the relative magnetic permeability mu. and, unlike the nonmagnetic case, exhibits sharp drops in the small-particle limit and never coincides with the phase velocity nu (p). Both nu (E) and D exhibit an oscillatory dependence on mu and vanish for certain values of mu. Since mu. of ferromagnetic scatterers strongly depends on the temperature and applied magnetic field, we suggest that these facts can be explored in technological applications.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Multiple scattering of electromagnetic waves in disordered magnetic media: localization parameter, energy transport velocity and diffusion constant
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Multiple scattering of electromagnetic waves in disordered magnetic media: localization parameter, energy transport velocity and diffusion constant

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: esp. ondas eletromagnética por part. magnéticas

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We review some of our recent results concerning the single and multiple eletromagnetic scattering by magnetic spherical particles. For a single electromagnetic scattering we show that the magnetic contribution alters, when compared to nonmagnetic scattering, the behavior of the cross sections and mean cosine of the scattering angle ([cos theta]). For ferromagnetic particles, resonances may occur even in the small-particle limit when the particle radius is much smaller than the wavelength. The resonances increase the cross-sections while [cos theta] is diminished, and even may become negative. Several quantities such the Ioffe-Regel parameter for localization are calculated for the multiple scattering regime. We show that magnetic scattering favors the observation of localization of electromagnetic waves in three dimensions. Further, this is also verified for dynamical experiments, where we show that the diffusion constant can be very small. Since the magnetic permeability of the scatterers can vary significatively around the Curie-Weiss critical temperature, experiments should be done on the microwave region and the scatterers should be soft ferrites. Some aspects of such experiment are presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We review some of our recent results concerning the single and multiple eletromagnetic scattering by magnetic spherical particles. For a single electromagnetic scattering we show that the magnetic contribution alters, when compared to nonmagnetic scattering, the behavior of the cross sections and mean cosine of the scattering angle ([cos theta]). For ferromagnetic particles, resonances may occur even in the small-particle limit when the particle radius is much smaller than the wavelength. The resonances increase the cross-sections while [cos theta] is diminished, and even may become negative. Several quantities such the Ioffe-Regel parameter for localization are calculated for the multiple scattering regime. We show that magnetic scattering favors the observation of localization of electromagnetic waves in three dimensions. Further, this is also verified for dynamical experiments, where we show that the diffusion constant can be very small. Since the magnetic permeability of the scatterers can vary significatively around the Curie-Weiss critical temperature, experiments should be done on the microwave region and the scatterers should be soft ferrites. Some aspects of such experiment are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Deterministic Walks in Random Media
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Deterministic Walks in Random Media

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Deterministic walks over a random set of N points in one and two dimensions (d = 1,2) are considered. Points ("cities") are randomly scattered in R-d following a uniform distribution. A walker ("tourist"), at each time step, goes to the nearest neighbor city that has not been visited in the past tau steps. Each initial city leads to a different trajectory composed of a transient part and a final p-cycle attractor. Transient times (for d = 1,2) follow an exponential law with a tau -dependent decay time but the density of p cycles can be approximately described by D(p) proportional to p(-alpha(tau)). For tau >> 1 and tau /N << 1, the exponent is independent of tau. Some analytical results are given for the d = 1 case.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Deterministic walks over a random set of N points in one and two dimensions (d = 1,2) are considered. Points ("cities") are randomly scattered in R-d following a uniform distribution. A walker ("tourist"), at each time step, goes to the nearest neighbor city that has not been visited in the past tau steps. Each initial city leads to a different trajectory composed of a transient part and a final p-cycle attractor. Transient times (for d = 1,2) follow an exponential law with a tau -dependent decay time but the density of p cycles can be approximately described by D(p) proportional to p(-alpha(tau)). For tau >> 1 and tau /N << 1, the exponent is independent of tau. Some analytical results are given for the d = 1 case.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Neurotoxin isolated from social wasp Agelaia vicina venom inhibits the gamma-aminobutyric acid and glutamate uptake in synaptosomes from rat cerebral cortex

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The action of amino acid neurotransmitters in synapses of most vertebrates is terminated by transporters into the presynaptic nerve terminal or neuroglia. Glutamate and $\gamma$-aminobutyric acid (GABA) are predominant excitatory and inibitory neurotransmitters in the brain, respectively. Venoms of several insects are composed of different molecules that are highly selective for nervous tissue. The abnormal operation of glutamate and GABA uptake systems is involved in several failures and the neurotoxins isolated from animal venom can provide tools to better understand these systems. Previous investigation demostrated that the deproteined venom from social wasp {\em Agelaia vicina} strongly inhibits high and low affinity GABA and glutamate uptake. The effects of the neurotoxin AvTx7 (molecular weight 1232), isolated by reverse phase chromatography from the {\em A. vicina} venom, were investigated on GABA or glutamate uptake and release in rat cerebral cortex synaptosomes. This toxin inhibits glutamate and GABA uptake and does not alter the GABA or glutamate release. These results suggest that AvTx7 may be a useful tool for further characterization of GABAamd glutamate uptake systems.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Effects of the crude venom and two fractions isolated from the solitary spider Scaptocosa raptoria on gamma-aminobutyric acid and glutamate uptake in synaptosomes from rat cerebral cortex

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Glutamate is the most important excitatory neurotransmitter while GABA is the major inhibitory neurotransmitter in the mammalian central nervous system. Glutamate and GABA actions in the synaptic cleft are terminated by transporters that belong to different families and are located in the membrane of neurons and glial cells. Venoms of orb-spiders and solitary wasps are composed of large proteins, medium-size peptides, low molecular weight and other neuroactive components that are highly selective for nervous tissues. The venom was fractioned by reverse phase HPLC chromatography. The effects of venom and some fraction named SrTx8 of solitary spider {\em S. raptoria} on GABA and Glu uptake in rat cerebral cortex synaptosomes have been partially characterized. The crude venom stimulates GABA uptake, while SrTx8 has no effect on Glu uptake at any dose used. The crude venom stimulates GABA uptake, whereas SrTx1 and SrTx8 inhibit GABA uptake. These results suggest that the venom and toxins from {\em S. raptoria} spider could be useful tools in further characterizing GABA and glutamate neurotransmission systems.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Pericentric inversion of chromossome 9 in recurrent reproductive loss

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Chromosome heteromorphisms involving the pericentric region of chromosome 9 have been associated to early recurrent abortions. However, results and opinions about the clinical significance of pericentric inversions remain contradictory. We have performed cytogenetic analysis of 120 unrelated couples who had presented two or more spontaneous abortions due to indeterminate causes. The control group was made up of 384 individuals. Chromosomal studies have included GTG, CBG, NOR and high resolution bandings. Ten couples ($8.3\%$) presented a major chromosome aberration and 33 couples ($27.5 \%$) showed a polymorphic chromosome 9. Pericentric inversion involving the 9q region was detected in $9.1\%$ of the couples and in $1.3\%$ of the samples of the control group. This finding was caracterized by F.I.S.H. technique using CEP 9 alpha satellite (VYSIS), beta (D9Z5) and satellite III (D9Z1) DNA probes. In all cases, the breakpoints were located in euchromatic regions, confirming the cytogenetic diagnosis. The origin was maternal in 80\% of the cases. Frequencies of individuals and of couples carrying inv(9) were compared to the frequencies shown by the general population and to the the frequency reported by 11 authors, revealing a significant difference between observed and expected ratios. Our results suggest a correlation between pericentric inversions of chromosome 9 and recurrent reproductive loss.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Optimization of Radiographics Images of Chest, Skull and Pelvis

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MARTINEZ, A. S.;Martinez, Alexandre Souto;MARTINEZ, A;Martinez, Alexandre S.;Martinez, A. S;Souto Martinez, Alexandre;SOUTOMARTINEZ, A

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work we construct a homogeneous phantom based in the work published by ANSI (1982), for calibrating the X-ray beam. Each homogeneous Phanton was used in the time-scale sensitometric method for obtaining a radiographic technique which is able to produce in the film, an optical density around 1.0 higher than the density of base plus fog. These radiographic techniques was applied in a anthropomorphic Phantom (Rando) and its images was analyzed by specialists in radiographic technique. These techniques was obtained in an X-ray equipament mono and three-phase of high frequency. The reproduction of this technique for another equipament was realized according to the quality of the standard beam and its intensity. In order to obtain validity of such techniques for another equipaments we constructed an realistic/analytic phantom. Using LIF thermoluminescent dosimeters we compare doses from the standard techniques woh that used in routine of the Hospital da Clínicas de Ribeirão Preto´s (HCRP) radiodiagnosis services. The techniques obtained in this study produced excellent radiographic images. The doses were reduced to 37.5\%, 41\% and 32\% of previous values, for thorax, skull and pelvis, respectively. The variation of contrast and resolution in reproducing the standard technique for another equipament in each exam was smaller that 1\%. The utilization of these techniques in all equipament of a service makes to reduce the rejection of films rate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Enantioselective analysis of atenolol in biologic fluids: comparison of liquid liquid and solid-phase extraction methods
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Enantioselective analysis of atenolol in biologic fluids: comparison of liquid liquid and solid-phase extraction methods

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this study we evaluated a liquid?liquid extraction procedure and a solid-phase extraction procedure for sample preparation for the enantioselective analysis of atenolol in plasma and urine by high-performance liquid chromatography. A Chiralcel OD-H column was used for the resolution of atenolol enantiomers with hexane?ethanol (85:15, v/v) plus 0.1% diethylamine as the mobile phase. In the liquid?liquid extraction procedure, atenolol was extracted from alkalinized body fluids with 5 ml chloroform?2-propanol (4:1, v/v). In the solid-phase extraction procedure, atenolol was isolated from plasma using a C8 column and methanol. Both extraction procedures were efficient in recovering atenolol and removing endogenous interferents. The RSDs and deviation from nominal values were lower than 10% for both within-day and between-day assays. The results show that there were no statistically significant differences in between-day variation. The t-test showed that there were no significant differences between the real concentrations and the determined concentrations. The limit of quantitation was 10 ng/ml and the linear range was 10?5000 ng/ml for both methods. These methods can be used in pharmacokinetic studies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Deterministic walks in random networks: an application to thesaurus graphs
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Deterministic walks in random networks: an application to thesaurus graphs

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In a landscape composed of N randomly distributed sites in Euclidean space, a walker ("tourist") goes to the nearest one that has not been visited in the last \tau steps. This procedure leads to trajectories composed of a transient part and a final cyclic attractor of period p. The tourist walk presents a simple scaling with respect to and can be performed in a wide range of networks that can be viewed as ordinal neighborhood graphs. As an example, we show that graphs defined by thesaurus dictionaries share some of the statistical properties of low-dimensional (d=2) Euclidean graphs and are easily distinguished from random link networks which correspond to the d -> infinity limit. This approach furnishes complementary information to the usual clustering coefficient and mean minimum separation length.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In a landscape composed of N randomly distributed sites in Euclidean space, a walker ("tourist") goes to the nearest one that has not been visited in the last \tau steps. This procedure leads to trajectories composed of a transient part and a final cyclic attractor of period p. The tourist walk presents a simple scaling with respect to and can be performed in a wide range of networks that can be viewed as ordinal neighborhood graphs. As an example, we show that graphs defined by thesaurus dictionaries share some of the statistical properties of low-dimensional (d=2) Euclidean graphs and are easily distinguished from random link networks which correspond to the d -> infinity limit. This approach furnishes complementary information to the usual clustering coefficient and mean minimum separation length.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Risk aversion in economic transactions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Risk aversion in economic transactions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Most people are risk-averse (risk-seeking) when they expect to gain ( lose). Based on a generalization of expected utility theory which takes this into account, we introduce an automaton mimicking the dynamics of economic operations. Each operator is characterized by a parameter q which gauges people's attitude under risky choices; this index q is in fact the entropic one which plays a central role in nonextensive statistical mechanics. Different long-term patterns of average asset redistribution are observed according to the distribution of parameter q (chosen once forever for each operator) and the rules ( e. g., the probabilities involved in the gamble and the indebtedness restrictions) governing the values that are exchanged in the transactions. Analytical and numerical results are discussed in terms of how the sensitivity to risk affects the dynamics of economic transactions.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Most people are risk-averse (risk-seeking) when they expect to gain ( lose). Based on a generalization of expected utility theory which takes this into account, we introduce an automaton mimicking the dynamics of economic operations. Each operator is characterized by a parameter q which gauges people's attitude under risky choices; this index q is in fact the entropic one which plays a central role in nonextensive statistical mechanics. Different long-term patterns of average asset redistribution are observed according to the distribution of parameter q (chosen once forever for each operator) and the rules ( e. g., the probabilities involved in the gamble and the indebtedness restrictions) governing the values that are exchanged in the transactions. Analytical and numerical results are discussed in terms of how the sensitivity to risk affects the dynamics of economic transactions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Racemization and degradation of thioridazine and thioridazine 2-sulfone in human plasma and aqueous solutions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Racemization and degradation of thioridazine and thioridazine 2-sulfone in human plasma and aqueous solutions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we present two methods for the enantioselective analysis of thioridazine (THD) and thioridazine 2-sulfone (THD 2-SO2) in human plasma based on liquid-liquid extraction with diethyl ether and chiral resolution of the enantiomers on Chiralpak AD and Chiralcel OD-H column, respectively. After validation, the methods were used to study the degradation and racemization of both drug and metabolite. Our results showed that both enantiomers of THD and THD 2-SO2 were stable at varying temperatures, pH and ionic strengths; however, solubility problems for THD and THD 2-SO2 enantiomers were observed, mainly at pH 8.5. The influence of light on the stability of the THD and THD 2-SO2 enantiomers was studied using standard solutions and degradation of the THD enantiomers was observed under UV light (254 and 366 nm). THD 2-SO2 enantiomers were stable at these wavelength and also when exposed to visible light.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper we present two methods for the enantioselective analysis of thioridazine (THD) and thioridazine 2-sulfone (THD 2-SO2) in human plasma based on liquid-liquid extraction with diethyl ether and chiral resolution of the enantiomers on Chiralpak AD and Chiralcel OD-H column, respectively. After validation, the methods were used to study the degradation and racemization of both drug and metabolite. Our results showed that both enantiomers of THD and THD 2-SO2 were stable at varying temperatures, pH and ionic strengths; however, solubility problems for THD and THD 2-SO2 enantiomers were observed, mainly at pH 8.5. The influence of light on the stability of the THD and THD 2-SO2 enantiomers was studied using standard solutions and degradation of the THD enantiomers was observed under UV light (254 and 366 nm). THD 2-SO2 enantiomers were stable at these wavelength and also when exposed to visible light.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Escaping from cycles through a glass transition
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Escaping from cycles through a glass transition

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Physical Review. E, Statistical, Nonlinear, and Soft Matter Physics (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A random walk is performed on a disordered landscape composed of $N$ sites randomly and uniformly distributed inside a $d$-dimensional hypercube. The walker hops from one site to another with probability proportional to $\exp [- \beta E(D)]$, where $\beta = 1/T$ is the inverse of a formal temperature and $E(D)$ is an arbitrary cost function which depends on the hop distance $D$. Analytic results indicate that, if $E(D) = D^{d}$ and $N \rightarrow \infty$, there exists a glass transition at $\beta_d = \pi^{d/2}/\Gamma(d/2 + 1)$. Below $T_d$, the average trapping time diverges and the system falls into an out-of-equilibrium regime with aging phenomena. A L\'evy flight scenario and applications of exploratory behavior are considered. Cond-mat/0210563
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A random walk is performed on a disordered landscape composed of $N$ sites randomly and uniformly distributed inside a $d$-dimensional hypercube. The walker hops from one site to another with probability proportional to $\exp [- \beta E(D)]$, where $\beta = 1/T$ is the inverse of a formal temperature and $E(D)$ is an arbitrary cost function which depends on the hop distance $D$. Analytic results indicate that, if $E(D) = D^{d}$ and $N \rightarrow \infty$, there exists a glass transition at $\beta_d = \pi^{d/2}/\Gamma(d/2 + 1)$. Below $T_d$, the average trapping time diverges and the system falls into an out-of-equilibrium regime with aging phenomena. A L\'evy flight scenario and applications of exploratory behavior are considered. Cond-mat/0210563

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Analytical results for the statistical distribution related to a memoryless deterministic walk: Dimensionality effect and mean-field models
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Analytical results for the statistical distribution related to a memoryless deterministic walk: Dimensionality effect and mean-field models

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Physical Review. E, Statistical, Nonlinear, and Soft Matter Physics (Print)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A random walk is performed over a disordered media composed of $N$ sites random and uniformly distributed inside a $d$-dimensional hypercube. The walker cannot remain in the same site and hops to one of its $n$ neighboring sites with a transition probability that depends on the distance $D$ between sites according to a cost function $E(D)$. The stochasticity level is parameterized by a formal temperature $T$. In the case $T = 0$, the walk is deterministic and ergodicity is broken: the phase space is divided in a ${\cal O}(N)$ number of attractor basins of two-cycles that trap the walker. For $d = 1$, analytic results indicate the existence of a glass transition at $T_1 = 1/2$ as $N \rightarrow \infty$. Below $T_1$, the average trapping time in two-cycles diverges and out-of-equilibrium behavior appears. Similar glass transitions occur in higher dimensions choosing a proper cost function. We also present some results for the statistics of distances for Poisson spatial point processes. cond-mat/0301147
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A random walk is performed over a disordered media composed of $N$ sites random and uniformly distributed inside a $d$-dimensional hypercube. The walker cannot remain in the same site and hops to one of its $n$ neighboring sites with a transition probability that depends on the distance $D$ between sites according to a cost function $E(D)$. The stochasticity level is parameterized by a formal temperature $T$. In the case $T = 0$, the walk is deterministic and ergodicity is broken: the phase space is divided in a ${\cal O}(N)$ number of attractor basins of two-cycles that trap the walker. For $d = 1$, analytic results indicate the existence of a glass transition at $T_1 = 1/2$ as $N \rightarrow \infty$. Below $T_1$, the average trapping time in two-cycles diverges and out-of-equilibrium behavior appears. Similar glass transitions occur in higher dimensions choosing a proper cost function. We also present some results for the statistics of distances for Poisson spatial point processes. cond-mat/0301147

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Study on thioridazine 5-sulfoxide epimerization and degradation by capillary electrophoresis
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Study on thioridazine 5-sulfoxide epimerization and degradation by capillary electrophoresis

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.LOCAL-DE-PUBLICACAO: WILEY-V C H VERLAG GMBH, PO BO

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: We present a method for the stereoselective analysis of thioridazine 5-sulfoxide (THD 5-SO) in human plasma based on liquid-liquid extraction with diethyl ether and chiral resolution of the stereoisomers by capillary electrophoresis using hydroxypropyl-beta-cyclodextrin and sulfated P-cyclodextrin as chiral selectors. The method showed recovery rates of 85.5% for both THD 5-SO (slow-eluting, SE) enantiomers. The coefficients of variation observed in the precision studies, as well as the accuracy values, were below 10%. After validation, the method was used to study the stability and configurational changes of this THID metabolite. Our results showed that both enantiomers of THD 5-SO (SE) were stable under conditions of variation of temperatures (38degreesC, 4degreesC and -20degreesC), pH (5.0, 7.0 and 8.5) and ionic strengths (0.2, 0.5 and 1.0 mol/L). The influence of light on the stability of the THD 5-SO (SE) stereoisomers was also studied using standard solutions prepared in methanol and an inversion in configuration was observed under UV light (254 and 366 nm). (fator de impacto: 4.325)
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: We present a method for the stereoselective analysis of thioridazine 5-sulfoxide (THD 5-SO) in human plasma based on liquid-liquid extraction with diethyl ether and chiral resolution of the stereoisomers by capillary electrophoresis using hydroxypropyl-beta-cyclodextrin and sulfated P-cyclodextrin as chiral selectors. The method showed recovery rates of 85.5% for both THD 5-SO (slow-eluting, SE) enantiomers. The coefficients of variation observed in the precision studies, as well as the accuracy values, were below 10%. (fator de impacto: 4.325)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Thesaurus as a complex network
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Thesaurus as a complex network

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A thesaurus is one, out of many, possible representations of term (or word) connectivity. The terms of a thesaurus are seen as the nodes and their relationship as the links of a directed graph. The directionality of the links retains all the thesaurus information and allows the measurement of several quantities. This has lead to a new term classification according to the characteristics of the nodes, for example, nodes with no links in, no links out, etc. Using an electronic available thesaurus we have obtained the incoming and outgoing link distributions. While the incoming link distribution follows a stretched exponential function, the lower bound for the outgoing link distribution has the same envelope of the scientific paper citation distribution proposed by Albuquerque and Tsallis. However, a better fit is obtained by simpler function which is the solution of Ricatti's differential equation. We conjecture that this differential equation is the continuous limit of a stochastic growth model of the thesaurus network. We also propose a new manner to arrange a thesaurus using the ``inversion method''.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A thesaurus is one, out of many, possible representations of term (or word) connectivity. The terms of a thesaurus are seen as the nodes and their relationship as the links of a directed graph. The directionality of the links retains all the thesaurus information and allows the measurement of several quantities. This has lead to a new term classification according to the characteristics of the nodes, for example, nodes with no links in, no links out, etc. Using an electronic available thesaurus we have obtained the incoming and outgoing link distributions. While the incoming link distribution follows a stretched exponential function, the lower bound for the outgoing link distribution has the same envelope of the scientific paper citation distribution proposed by Albuquerque and Tsallis. However, a better fit is obtained by simpler function which is the solution of Ricatti's differential equation. We conjecture that this differential equation is the continuous limit of a stochastic growth model of the thesaurus network. We also propose a new manner to arrange a thesaurus using the ``inversion method''.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Inferring topological features of proteins from amino acid residue networks
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Inferring topological features of proteins from amino acid residue networks

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Topological properties of native folds are obtained from statistical analysis of 160 low homology proteins covering the four structural classes. This is done analyzing one, two and three-vertex joint distribution of quantities related to the corresponding network of amino acid residues. Emphasis on the amino acid residue hydrophobicity leads to the definition of their center of mass as vertices in this contact network model with interactions represented by edges. The network analysis helps us to interpret experimental results such as hydrophobic scales and fraction of buried accessible surface area in terms of the network connectivity. Moreover, those networks show assortative mixing by degree. To explore the vertextype dependent correlations, we build a network of hydrophobic and polar vertices. This procedure presents the wiring diagram of the topological structure of globular proteins leading to the following attachment probabilities between hydrophobic?hydrophobic 0.424(5), hydrophobic-polar 0.419(2) and polar?polar 0.157(3) residues.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Topological properties of native folds are obtained from statistical analysis of 160 low homology proteins covering the four structural classes. This is done analyzing one, two and three-vertex joint distribution of quantities related to the corresponding network of amino acid residues. Emphasis on the amino acid residue hydrophobicity leads to the definition of their center of mass as vertices in this contact network model with interactions represented by edges. The network analysis helps us to interpret experimental results such as hydrophobic scales and fraction of buried accessible surface area in terms of the network connectivity. Moreover, those networks show assortative mixing by degree. To explore the vertextype dependent correlations, we build a network of hydrophobic and polar vertices. This procedure presents the wiring diagram of the topological structure of globular proteins leading to the following attachment probabilities between hydrophobic?hydrophobic 0.424(5), hydrophobic-polar 0.419(2) and polar?polar 0.157(3) residues.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Propriedades de Transportes de Matéria Condensada (Não Eletrônica)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
We study numerically, using the Mie theory, light transmission through a multiply scattering medium composed of a collection of uncorrelated, optically inactive spherical particles. The characteristic length over which a plane wave field is depolarized depends on whether it is initially linearly or circularly polarized and of the size of the particles In a medium containing particles small compared to the wavelength, the characteristic length of depolarization for incident linearly polarized light is found to exceed that for incident circularly polarized light, while the opposite is true in a medium composed of particles large compared to the wavelength. Comparison of numerical results with data from measurements on suspensions of polystyrene latex spheres in water is made. Agreement between these simulations and experiment is good for the range of sizes considered in this paper. We also discuss the relevance of the helicity flip model to the analysis of these data.
Polarimetry and Ellipsometry Conf. 20-23 May 1996 Kazimierz Dolny, Poland
